nodes.text: Tangenine was a planet located in the Tangenine sector in Core Worlds region. It was home to syndicates which extorted the people and gained prominence when the Separatist Alliance dealt damage to Tangenine's infrastructure during the Clone Wars. After the war came to a close in 19 BBY, the Galactic Empire sought to bring order to Tangenine, and used bounty hunters to route out the syndicates. One such hunter was Brand, who focused her work on the Malandro syndicate. After disliking the Empire's growing corruption, she took a job off-world on the Rebel Alliance Captain Micha Evon.
Tangenine was a planet located in the Tangenine sector, an acclaimed sector in the galaxy's Core Worlds region. The world had cities and at least one farm and school.

During the reign of the Galactic Republic, the Malandro syndicate operated on Tangenine. When the norango farmer Remba refused to pay the Malandro's protection fees, the syndicate's Falleen gangster, Annaz, and her henchmen were sent to her farm. Remba and her lover Kelven sent their children, Lauren Mel Coelho and Julien, to live with their gran. Annaz then killed the two farmers and their workers. After a few years passed, Lauren and Julien's gran died to a fever, and after Julien also fell ill, Lauren took a job from the Malandro syndicate to pay for the cure, stealing a speeder. However, she was caught and imprisoned during the job, and Julien died before she got out of prison.

During the Clone Wars between the Republic and the Separatist Alliance, Tangenine's infrastructure saw damage from the Separatists. As a result, syndicates gained more prominence, further extorting the people of Tangenine. After the Clone Wars ended with the Separatist's defeat in 19 BBY, the Republic transitioned into the Galactic Empire. The Empire tried to bring order to Tangenine, but found the syndicates were deeply embedded and turned to bounty hunters to help quell the issue.

Lauren Mel Coelho resurfaced as a bounty hunter under the name Brand, and took jobs almost exclusively on the Malandro syndicate, eventually finding and torturing Annaz at the Falleen's desk. The syndicates were gradually routed from Tangenine, allowing the Empire's rule to become more corrupt. Brand became displeased a thief was given life sentence in prison and a gang leader was freed after bribing a magistrate. As a result, she chose to take a break from her work on Tangenine and chose to take a job off-world on Micha Evon, a captain in the Rebel Alliance who led the Alliance's 61st Mobile Infantry.

Tangenine was first mentioned in the 2015 novel Battlefront: Twilight Company, written by Alexander Freed. The planet then first appeared in flashbacks in the short story "Inbrief," written by Janine K. Spendlove and released as part of the hundred and sixty-first issue of Star Wars Insider on November 10 of that year.
